abstract_summ: Comparisons using genome features like genes, gene order, and regulatory sequences are carried out with this purpose in mind.Surprisingly, significant mammal genome nullomers are often present, but rare, in other mammals, suggesting that they are suppressed but not completely forbidden.When we consider gene order to compare two genomes, it is possible to use a parsimony criterion to estimate how close the species are.In this work, we study the reversal distance between genomes with duplicated genes considering that the orientation of genes is unknown.A type of gene loss widespread in the lineages of plant genomes is “fractionation” after whole genome doubling or tripling, where one of a pair or triplet of paralogous genes in parallel syntenic contexts is discarded.

title_abstract_phrases: Comparisons using genome features like genes, gene order, and regulatory sequences are carried out with this purpose in mind.One of the most studied genome rearrangement is the transposition, which occurs when a sequence of genes is moved to another position inside the genome.We are interested in the shortest sequence of genome rearrangements capable of transforming one genome into the other, which is named rearrangement distance.Surprisingly, significant mammal genome nullomers are often present, but rare, in other mammals, suggesting that they are suppressed but not completely forbidden.In this work, we study the reversal distance between genomes with duplicated genes considering that the orientation of genes is unknown.
